description: The US and Israel agreed to hold an in-person meeting to discuss their dispute over an expected Israeli invasion of the southern Gaza Strip city of Rafah, after Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu scrapped an earlier visit amid increasingly sour ties.
title: Israel Agrees to US Talks on Rafah After Scrapping Earlier Visit

description: A top Joe Biden campaign official highlighted the importance Democrats are placing on abortion access in the 2024 presidential election as a Florida court approved on Monday a statewide ballot initiative on reproductive rights.
title: Biden Campaign Sees Opportunity in Florida Abortion Ballot Measure

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, congressional reporter Billy House unpacks House Speaker Mike Johnson’s latest plans for Ukraine aid. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Sliver of ‘Hope’ Emerges for Ukraine Aid Deadlocked in House

description: Final rates for health insurers selling private Medicare Advantage plans will be the same as the government’s initial proposal in January, a blow to insurance companies that make billions selling private versions of the government coverage. Shares of health insurance companies fell in late trading.
title: Health Insurers Tumble as Final Medicare Advantage Rates Disappoint

description: US House Speaker Mike Johnson wants new Ukraine aid approved “right away” but is still grappling to soften opposition from hardliners, leaving doubts about whether billions of dollars in assistance will reach front lines in time to make a difference.
title: House Speaker Johnson Searches for Compromise to Speed Ukraine Aid

description: A shadow war between Israel and Iran has shaped the Middle East for decades. Of the many conflicts that have roiled the region, theirs has long been among the most explosive. The two have attacked each other — mostly quietly and in Iran’s case often by proxy — while avoiding an escalation into direct war. But as the fighting between Israel and the Iran-backed Palestinian group Hamas continues and other militant groups supported by Iran join the fray, the shadow war has entered a dangerous new ph
title: The Israel-Iran Shadow War Reaches a Dangerous New Phase

description: Dina Boluarte is discovering the risks of leading a country that jails ex-presidents so often that it built a special prison to hold them.
title: A $15,000 Rolex Threatens to Worsen Peru Leader’s 9% Approval Rating

description: President Felix Tshisekedi appoints Judith Tuluka Suminwa as the next prime minister of the Democratic Republic of Congo, his office said.
title: Congo Appoints Judith Tuluka Suminwa as New Prime Minister

description: Argentina won the dismissal of lawsuits by Aurelius Capital Management and other hedge funds seeking payment on securities tied to the performance of the South American nation’s economy.
title: Argentina Defeats Hedge Fund Suits Over GDP-Linked Securities

description: An Israeli airstrike on Iran’s embassy compound in Syria killed a number of people including a top military commander, Iranian and Syrian state media said, stoking tensions between the longtime adversaries.
title: Iran Says Israeli Strike on Its Compound Killed Top General

description: Crime has surged to the forefront of Brazilians’ minds in recent months, supplanting economic issues as their top concern and sparking consternation inside President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva’s administration over how to respond.
title: Crime Supplants Economy as Brazilians’ Top Worry, Rattling Lula

description: Nippon Steel Corp. made what it calls a formal commitment on spending and jobs to the United Steelworkers union, backing up a pledge made in an earlier meeting as the Japanese steelmaker looks to build support for its $14.1 billion acquisition of United States Steel Corp.
title: Nippon Steel Makes Formal Pledge to Union in Push for US Steel

description: Iranian state television said an Israeli airstrike targeted the country’s diplomatic buildings in the Syrian capital, killing a top commander of the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps.
title: Iran Says Revolutionary Guard Commander Killed in Israeli Strike on Syria

description: A company that bought property for a group of tech billionaires trying to build a sustainable city in northern California won a ruling advancing its lawsuit that accused landowners in the project’s target area of a conspiracy to drive up prices.
title: California Utopian City Backers Advance in Landowner Legal Fight

description: Caribbean “golden passports” are getting more expensive, a response to pressure from the US and the European Union to crack down on citizenship sales.
title: Caribbean Golden Passport Cost Soars to $200,000 on EU Crackdown

description: Russia is considering a raft of changes to tighten its immigration laws after Tajik nationals were accused of carrying out the worst atrocity in the capital in more than two decades.
title: Russia Weighs Tighter Migrant Worker Rules After Moscow Attack

description: Turkish leader Recep Tayyip Erdogan won a fresh mandate in parliamentary and presidential elections last summer. But he suffered a stinging defeat against the main opposition party in municipal elections held March 31 amid rampant inflation and the highest borrowing costs since the president swept to power more than two decades ago. The election results showed voters across the country turning against Erdogan’s AK party, but the swing was especially dramatic in the cities of Istanbul, the countr
title: How Turkey’s Local Elections Turned Into a Defeat for Erdogan

description: The oil-rich, semiautonomous region of Puntland said it will operate as a state that’s independent from Somalia until changes to the Somali constitution adopted on Saturday are approved via a popular referendum.
title: Puntland to Operate Independently From Somalia After Law Change

description: Mexico’s presidential frontrunner Claudia Sheinbaum held a 17-point lead one month into the official campaign period for the June election, according to a new poll.
title: Sheinbaum Holds 17-Point Lead in Mexico Race, Poll Shows

description: We already know Janet Yellen’s ideal lunch date: the late, legendary English economist John Maynard Keynes. And based on her custom as Treasury secretary, we can guess the venue would be a local pub in Keynes’ hometown, Cambridge.
title: Yellen’s Road Trips Have a Theme: Think Global, Eat Local

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan suffered an unprecedented defeat in municipal elections with the main opposition group making more inroads than ever in areas once dominated by the governing AK Party.
title: Erdogan’s Local Election Loss Dents Image of Invincible Leader

description: Istanbul Mayor Ekrem Imamoglu secured his status as the top opponent to President Recep Tayyip Erdogan as he extended his rule over the country’s largest city, a victory that could position him to one day take over from Turkey’s longest-serving leader.
title: Istanbul Win Gives Erdogan Nemesis Chance to Fight for President

description: New hate crime laws which came into force in Scotland on Monday are some of the most controversial legislation enacted by the Scottish Parliament in recent years.
title: Why Are Scotland's New Hate Crime Laws Prompting Concern?

description: They’re weighed down by student debt. They’re shut out of the housing market. They’re hit by higher costs of living. And they want President Joe Biden to listen.
title: Young Voters Are More Concerned With the Economy. That’s Bad for Biden

description: A Pakistani court temporarily suspended former Prime Minister Imran Khan’s 14-year jail sentence two months after he was found guilty of illegal dealings related to state gifts when he was in power.
title: Imran Khan’s Sentence in One Case Suspended by Pakistan Court

description: Russia plans to reduce daily diesel exports from key western ports in April to the lowest in five months, after Ukrainian drone attacks on refineries and seasonal maintenance sharply lowered crude processing rates.
title: Russia Plans to Cut Diesel Export by Sea in April to 5-Month Low

description: Ministers are facing a revolt from Conservative MPs over plans to criminalise homelessness, reports have suggested.
title: Ministers Facing Revolt Over Plans to Criminalise Rough Sleeping

description: India’s Prime Minister Narendra Modi blamed the main opposition party for ceding an island to Sri Lanka five decades ago when it was in power, dredging up a sensitive issue with an eye on capturing votes in a southern state where his Bharatiya Janata Party has failed to grain traction.
title: Modi Uses 1974 Island Deal With Sri Lanka to Attack Opposition

description: The US Ambassador to India said he was pleased with India’s progress on its investigation into an alleged plot to kill a Sikh activist last year, adding that the issue wouldn’t hamper relations between the two countries.
title: US-India Ties Not Damaged By Murder Plot Probe, Ambassador Says

description: Turkey’s lira weakened after President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s ruling party suffered a shock defeat at local elections on Sunday, with control of many of Turkey’s cities, including Istanbul and Ankara, going to the opposition.
title: Lira Dips After Turkey Opposition Parties Sweep Local Elections

description: Tens of thousands of people gathered in India’s capital on Sunday along with dozens of opposition chiefs in calling for a free and fair election — and to protest the arrests of some top political leaders, including the chief minister of Delhi.
title: Modi’s Opposition Unites in Delhi Rally Seeking Fair Elections

description: South Korea’s President Yoon Suk Yeol said Monday he won’t back down on a plan to increase the number of medical school seats while he remains open for talks in a weekslong dispute that has prompted the walkout of almost all the nation’s trainee doctors.
title: S. Korea’s Yoon Urges Doctors to Return, Leaves Room for Talks

description: Chinese leader Xi Jinping is set to meet Indonesian President-elect Prabowo Subianto in Beijing on Monday amid rising tensions in the South China Sea.
title: Xi Set to Meet Indonesia’s Prabowo in China Amid Tensions at Sea

description: Nippon Steel Corp.’s acquisition of United States Steel Corp. would strengthen economic security ties between the US and Japan and help counter China’s dominance in steel-making, according to a senior Japanese ruling party lawmaker.
title: Japanese Lawmaker Says US Steel Deal Would Help Counter China Risks

description: Argentine President Javier Milei doesn’t see his government dollarizing the economy before next year’s mid-term elections, providing the first inkling of a timeline on his most ambitious economic proposal from the campaign.
title: Milei Doesn’t See Argentina Dollarizing Before Midterm Vote
